org.cpsolver.studentsct.online.expectations

Interface OverExpectedCriterion.HasContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MinimizeConflicts
    Enclosing interface:
    OverExpectedCriterion

    public static interface OverExpectedCriterion.HasContext

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getOverExpected(Assignment<Request,Enrollment> assignment, Enrollment[] enrollment, int index, Section section, Request request)
      Expectation penalty, to be minimized

      Expectation penalty, to be minimized.

    • Method Detail

      • getOverExpected

        double getOverExpected(Assignment<Request,Enrollment> assignment,
                       Enrollment selection,
                       Enrollment value,
                       Set<Enrollment> conflicts)
        Expectation penalty, to be minimized. A variant of the OverExpectedCriterion.getOverExpected(Assignment, Section, Request) method that can be called from Constraint.computeConflicts(Assignment, Value, Set).
        Parameters:
        assignment - current assignment
        selection - selected enrollment question
        value - an enrollment to be assigned
        conflicts - enrollments that have been already identified as conflicting
        Returns:
        expectation penalty (typically 1.0 / number of subparts when over-expected, 0.0 otherwise)

      • getOverExpected

        double getOverExpected(Assignment<Request,Enrollment> assignment,
                       Enrollment[] enrollment,
                       int index,
                       Section section,
                       Request request)
        Expectation penalty, to be minimized
        Parameters:
        assignment - current assignment
        enrollment - current assignment of the student
        index - only use enrollments 0 .. index - 1 from the assignment array
        section - section in question
        request - student course request
        Returns:
        expectation penalty (typically 1.0 / number of subparts when over-expected, 0.0 otherwise)
